Messages.Author: Nils Neuhaus
Messages.Content: Liebes Integrationsmodul,  wie bereits angekündigt wurde, wechselt mit der morgigen Sitzung die Kursleitung für das Integrationsmodul. Ich werde den Kurs bis zum Semesterende übernehmen und auch die Benotung durchführen. Kurz zu meiner Person: Mein Name ist Nils Neuhaus, ich bin wissenschaftlicher Mitarbeiter am Berlin Ethics Lab und habe meinen disziplinären Hintergrund in der Philosophie. Morgen finden wir aber sicherlich auch Zeit für eine kurze Vorstellungsrunde.  Für unsere morgige Sitzung gibt es daher zunächst einen neuen Zoom-Link: https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/69713521754?pwd=4pazgdZj7nEKMT1VqbwdDhwdMuBcKi.1  Laut Kursplan war es Ihre Aufgabe zu morgen eine 5-minütige Präsentation vorzubereiten. Ich denke, das wird ein hervorragender Einsteig sein.  Alle weiteren Fragen zum Wechsel der Kursleitung, zur Prüfung usw. werden wir morgen gemeinsam angehen.  Bis morgen!  Herzliche Grüße Nils Neuhaus

Messages.Author: Martina Vortel
Messages.Content: Dear all, To those of you who were sick today, here is a little recap of what you missed: 1) there have been some changes made to the dates for your portfolio-examination. Your (8 min) final presentations of your ethical analysis and science communication project will be held in class (on zoom) on Tuesday, July 9th. You are also required to participate in the Berlin Ethics Certificate final exhibition the following day, July 10th, and display your work with a short (1 paragraph) abstract and an exhibition object/documentation of your science communication element.  Your written ethical analysis ("schriftliche Ausarbeitung") is also to be handed in via ISIS on July 9th (see "Prüfungshinweise").  Both of these examination elements will be graded on criteria pertaining to form and content.  The slides and "Prüfungshinweise" have been updated.  2) Please continue fill out your analysis on the Miro board. 3) For next session (18.06): proceed on your ethical analysis and science communication element. Try to keep in mind how this links to the original motivation of "transformative science".  You are also highly encouraged to meet amongst yourselves for an interdisciplinary exchange on your topics on June 11th.  As mentioned earlier, this was my last session with you. The person taking over this course will introduce themselevs to you via ISIS as soon as possible. Please note they will also create a new zoom link and post that in ISIS. They will be the new contact person for your interim questions. I am around until Friday if you have any further questions. All the best on your projects! Cheers, Martina

Messages.Author: Martina Vortel
Messages.Content: Dear class, I hope you enjoyed your peer-feedback session this week and are coming along well with your ethical questions and ideas for how to bring your projects to the wider community! I have a small request to make: since your level of critical reflection is high and since I want to give you the most fruitful "consultation" possible, I am wondering if it is possible that we hold next Tuesday's session in English? You can leave any text in German of course but if you're comfortable could you present your work in English? I noticed last time it was a bit hard for me to follow due to language and as I said, I want to be as check-in to your work as possible. If for any reason this puts too much stress on you then feel free to contribute in German. We will make it work in any case. As a reminder, you are to reflect on the questions in the left-hand-side grey boxes (i.e. Wer wird mitgedacht, was verändert sich mit, was könnte noch passieren, welche Normen/Werten sind wichtig, weitere Fragen/Gedanken) to ultimately derive your precise ethical question which frames the debate you are investigating. Ideally you also have some idea of how you want to proceed with your science communication project. Let me know if you have any further questions! Looking forward to Tuesday. Best, Martina

Messages.Content: Liebe Studierende, Die 1. Sitzung des Integrationsmoduls wird am 30.04 von 10-12 Uhr stattfinden (in zoom).  Wenn ihr in der Zwischenzeit fragen zum Kurs habt, bitte euch an martina.vortel@tu-berlin.de wendet. Beste Grüße Martina
